vision.translation[0].definitions[0].not: night vision (=the ability to see when it is dark)
vision.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
Tears blurred her vision (=made it difficult for her to see).
children who are born with poor vision
vision.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the area that you can see
vision.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: a figure at the edge of her vision
As the cars overtake you, they are temporarily outside your field of vision.
vision.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an idea of what you think something should be like
vision.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: a grand vision for the country
He had a clear vision of how he hoped the company would develop.
The president outlined his vision for the future.
vision.translation[0].definitions[3].def: something that you seem to see as part of a powerful religious experience
vision.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: She had a vision in which Jesus appeared before her.
He became a monk after seeing Saint Apollinaris in a vision.
vision.translation[0].definitions[4].def: the knowledge and imagination that are needed in planning for the future with a clear purpose
vision.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: We need a leader with vision and strong principles.
his enthusiasm and breadth of vision
vision.translation[0].definitions[5].def: the quality of a picture that you can see on a television
vision.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + vision
I have good vision in my right eye.
Short-sighted children may be unaware of what people with normal vision can see.
Babies aren’t born with perfect vision.
20–20 vision
The soldier had 20-20 vision.
poor/defective
Her vision was quite poor and she always wore glasses.
blurred
He complained of headaches and blurred vision.
night vision
Cats have good night vision but can’t see colour very well.
peripheral vision
She could read easily, but her peripheral vision was poor.
double vision
One of the symptoms of the illness is double vision.
tunnel vision
A pupil with tunnel vision may have difficulty finding the words written on the blackboard.
blur somebody’s vision
Tears of fury blurred her vision, and she blinked them away.
clear your vision
She blinked to clear her vision.
